title: Job Openings at UNICAF Nigeria
content:
UNICAF Nigeria is a leading online higher education platform, with a physical presence in 12 countries, assisting universities to go online.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Remote Worker

Job Location: Remote
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The ideal candidates will transform educational materials into online learning. We are seeking motivated individuals from Nigeria to help convert educational materials into engaging online content for our e-learning platform.


Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	A Bachelor’s degree (Master’s or PhD will be considered an advantage)
	Reliable internet access
	Good command of the English language
	Prior experience with Moodle or other learning management systems will be considered an advantage
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to meeting deadlines
	If you are tech-savvy, eager to learn, and passionate about online education, we would love to hear from you.


What We Offer


	Comprehensive training – no prior online experience required
	Flexibleworkoptions – part-time or full-time, fully remote
	An attractive remuneration package for qualified individuals
	The opportunity to play a vital role in expanding access to quality education across Africa.


Application Closing Date: 5th December, 2025. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send CV to: vacancies@nigeria.unicaf.org using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

2.) Remote Teacher

Job Location: Remote
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Join Our Mission to Expand Access to Quality Higher Education. We are seeking experienced and passionate academics across Africa to teach online and contribute to our growing network of international higher education programmes.
	This is an exciting opportunity to inspire and support students through a dynamic digital learning environment.


Requirements


	A PhD Degree in a relevant discipline (Master’s degree holders with extensive teaching and professional experience may also be considered)
	Reliable internet access
	Excellent command of the English language
	Prior experience with Moodle or other learning management systems will be considered an advantage
	A commitment to delivering high-quality, student-centered online teaching.


What We Offer


	Flexible work options – part-time or full-time, fully remote
	Comprehensive training on Unicaf’s online teaching platform
	An attractive remuneration package for qualified academics
	The opportunity to collaborate with an international academic community and impact learners worldwide


Application Closing Date: 8th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send CV to: vacancies@nigeria.unicaf.org using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: If you are passionate about higher education, technology-enhanced learning, and empowering students through online teaching, we would love to hear from you.

 

 

3.) Marketing Officer

Job Location: Plot 6, Isheri Ogunnusi Road, Ogba - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	UNICAF, a leading online platform providing affordable and quality higher education in partnership with universities in the UK, US and Africa, is seeking a Marketing Officer to join our team in Nigeria.
	The Marketing Officer will support the development and execution of marketing strategies to attract new students and retain existing ones. You will assist in campaigns, events, business development, and partner relationship management while contributing ideas that strengthen UNICAF’s presence in Nigeria.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in planning and implementing marketing & business development initiatives.
	Support campaigns, events, PR, and advertising activities.
	Research new opportunities, generate leads, and develop niche markets.
	Manage partner relationships and help increase customer value.
	Prepare reports, presentations, and marketing materials.
	Contribute to achieving organisational goals and KPIs.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or related field (Master’s degree is an advantage).
	Minimum of 3 years of marketing experience.
	Experience in the education sector is highly desirable.
	Strong skills in communication, negotiation, problem-solving, and organisation.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary (based on qualifications & experience).
	Opportunity to work with a global organisation transforming higher education.


Application Closing Date: 10th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified  candidates should send CV to: vacancies@nigeria.unicaf.org using “Application for the position of Marketing Officer in Nigeria” as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Openings at Efezi Southsea Nigeria Limited
content:
Efezi Southsea Nigeria Limited is a hospitality consultant company incorporated in 2009 primarily to provide hospitality services to small and medium hotels.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Male Hotel Accountant

Job Location: Lagos

Role Summary


	We are seeking a qualified and experienced Hotel Accountant to manage and oversee all hotel financial operations.
	The ideal candidate must possess a strong understanding of hotel accounting systems, cost control, and software applications specific to the hospitality industry.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Maintain accurate financial records and prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reports.
	Manage accounts payable and receivable, revenue, and expense tracking.
	Handle payroll processing and statutory remittances.
	Prepare and analyze budgets, forecasts, and financial statements.
	Ensure compliance with hotel financial policies and internal controls.
	Collaborate with management to enhance financial performance and cost efficiency.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree
	Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Hotel Accountant or similar role.
	Excellent knowledge of hotel management and accounting software (e.g., Opera PMS, Micros, Sage, or similar systems).
	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills.
	Professional certification (ICAN or equivalent) is an added advantage.


Salary
N150,000 - N160,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: efezisouthsea2000@gmail.com using “Hotel Accountant Application” as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Internal Auditor (Male / Female)

Job Location: Lagos

Role Summary


	We are seeking a qualified and experienced Hotel Internal Auditor to oversee and evaluate the financial and operational systems within our hospitality operations.
	The ideal candidate must demonstrate solid auditing experience, deep knowledge of hotel procedures, and strong proficiency in hotel management software.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct regular audits of financial transactions, operational procedures, and control systems.
	Review and verify daily revenue reports, cash receipts, and accounting records.
	Ensure compliance with internal policies, accounting standards, and statutory regulations.
	Identify process gaps, financial risks, and opportunities for efficiency improvement.
	Prepare detailed audit reports and present findings to management.
	Collaborate with department heads to strengthen financial integrity and accountability.


Requirements


	Minimum of 5 years of experience as an Internal Auditor within the hospitality industry.
	Strong knowledge of hotel accounting and management software (e.g., Opera PMS, Micros, Sage, or similar systems).
	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Professional certification (e.g., ICAN, ACCA, or CIA) is an added advantage.
	Excellent analytical, communication, and reporting skills.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: efezisouthsea2000@gmail.com using “Hotel Internal Auditor Application” as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Male Food & Beverage Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Role Summary


	We are looking for an experienced and dynamic Food & Beverage (F&B) Manager to oversee all food and beverage operations within the hotel.
	The ideal candidate must possess a solid background in hospitality management, exceptional leadership skills, and excellent knowledge of hotel software and systems.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, organize, and manage all F&B operations to ensure quality service and guest satisfaction.
	Supervise restaurant, bar, kitchen, and banquet operations.
	Develop menus, pricing, and promotional strategies in collaboration with the Executive Chef.
	Monitor inventory, cost control, and revenue performance.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and hygiene standards.
	Train and motivate staff to maintain high service standards.
	Utilize hotel software for reporting, reservations, and operational analysis.


Requirements


	Minimum of 5 years of experience as an F&B Manager or in a similar leadership role in the hospitality industry.
	Strong proficiency in hotel management and POS software (e.g., Opera PMS, Micros, or similar systems).
	Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Hospitality Management or related field.
	Excellent organizational, communication, and leadership skills.
	Proven ability to drive guest satisfaction and maximize profitability.


Salary
N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: efezisouthsea2000@gmail.com using “F&B Manager Application” as the subject of the email.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the CEO

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Summary

	The Executive Assistant (EA) to the CEO is responsible for providing high-level administrative and strategic support to the CEO, ensuring seamless coordination of daily operations, communications, and executive functions.
	The EA will act as a liaison between the CEO and internal/external stakeholders, managing schedules, confidential information, and critical business tasks to enhance executive productivity.


Key Responsibilities


	Serve as the primary point of contact between the CEO and internal/external stakeholders.
	Coordinate with various departments to ensure smooth executive operations.
	Manage the CEO’s calendar, scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
	Anticipate CEO’s needs in advance of meetings, conferences, etc.

	Draft, review, and edit emails, reports, and other business correspondence.

	Conduct research and prepare reports on industry trends, competitors, and business opportunities.
	Track action items and ensure timely follow-up on key tasks.
	Maintain organized filing systems (digital and physical).

	Male candidates preferred.

	Type of Qualification: BSc
	Field of Study: Finance and Accounting, and ACCA or ICAN or CIMA certification


Experience Required:
Reconciliations:


	1-2 years of basic knowledge of transaction processing workflow and control processes, and general knowledge of pension’s matters and a minimum of 1 year experience in a financial service environment preferably wealth management.
	Strong general knowledge and exposure to general financial markets, within a financial institution, as a Reconciliation Officer capturing and processing financial data input on financial or accounting systems, applying financial processes and procedures. Good finance product knowledge related to reconciliation services.


Behavioural Competencies:


	Checking Details
	Resolution processing
	Embracing Change
	Taking Action
	Following Procedures
	Generating Ideas


Technical Competencies:


	Resolution Processing
	Client Engagement/Industry Knowledge
	Processing
	Data Management (Administration)
	Driving Delivery of Results.

Finance & Administrative Assistant Job at Achieving Health Nigeria Initiative (AHNi)




        
    

        
        Achieving Health Nigeria Initiative (AHNi) is a non-profit organization that promotes socio-economic development by supporting global health and economic initiatives in Nigeria. It was established as indigenous organizational, registered in 2009 with its headquarter in Abuja, and presence in the four geopolitical regions of Nigeria.  It aims to provide technical assistance to the government and people of Nigeria in the implementation of public health and development programs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance & Administrative Assistant

Job Locations: Adamawa and Taraba

Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Finance & Administrative Officer will be responsible for the provision of accounting, administrative, and logistical support services to AHNi State Offices.
	S/He will assist in the preparation of monthly financial report forms, which accompany executed sub-awardee project documents, attend to all administrative functions in the Finance unit, prepare monthly reporting/ budgets data entry into excel spreadsheets and automated MIS reports and disseminate information to AHNi State offices/HQ.
	Also, s/he will manage and ensure quality in all GF events logistics – Reservations (Accommodation/Flights/Venue etc.), meals, event materials, attendance, support finance with needed information’s/documents to make prompt participants payment, support in the State office’s procurement process including, but not limited to, purchase requests, prequalifying vendors, soliciting quotes, collating quotation/bids from prequalified/potential vendors, the vendor selection process through receipt and payment for goods and/or services etc.  


Minimum Recruitment Standard


	University Degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration
	Experience with administrative and secretarial skills
	Sound accounting skills
	Experience with large complex organization is required, familiarity with international NGOs preferred.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified Candidates should forward their suitability statement (application) and resume (CV) as a single MS Word document to: AHNi-FandAJobs@ahnigeria.org.ng using the Job Position and location as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	AHNi is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
	Disclaimer: AHNi does not charge Candidates a fee for a test or interview.
